intro: Hieracium speirophyllum, commonly known as the spiked hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and cool climates. Its leaves are basal, rough, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Hieracium speirophyllum is also notable for its ability to produce a large number of seeds, contributing to its distribution across its native range.
